It is likely unrealistic to expect everyone and every company to benefit from AI and not have any industry or sector hollowed out.

Especially when companies are actively laying off people as part of the AI revolution / craze / justification / resource-allocation efforts.

The perfect future you describe sounds too much like an election speech rather than a depiction of reality, and is unnecessary - personal computers, the internet, smartphones, AI and other technologies did and replace others and companies di falter. I see no need in painting the world in unrealistically bright colors. It feels like marketing, like an attempt to create false pretense, to induce trust more than is warranted.

A world that will change with some winners and some losers is still not zero-sum thinking. I still believe AI will create opportunities and advancements, just not for everyone.
